page.title: 19THE CHURCH IN SESSAY
page.content: {St. Cuthbert's,}Sessay, is Church of England and is attended by most of the villagers, though other denominations are of course represented.{Chapels} used to exist at Hutton Sessay and Little Hutton but they are now houses. The Church is linked with our Primary School and the children contribute to the celebration of religious festivals by participation in services and decoration of the building. Also a {Sunday Club}for 3-13 year olds meets each week except the first Sunday in the month when they attend Family Service in the Church. At around 13 years young people may progress to Confirmation classes. There is also a{housegroup}in Sessay - the 9 or 10 members of which meet in private houses to pray together and try to gain through discussion a better understanding of the Bible.
